Uses of Package
ch.lambdaj.function.closure

Packages that use ch.lambdaj.function.closure
ch.lambdaj   
ch.lambdaj.function.closure   
 

Classes in ch.lambdaj.function.closure used by ch.lambdaj
Closure
          A generic (not strongly typed) lambdaj closure
Closure1
          A closure with a single free variable
Closure2
          A closure with two free variables
Closure3
          A closure with three free variables
Closure4
          A closure with four free variables
ClosureResult
          The result returned by a closure defined through the delayed syntax
DelayedClosure
          Extends this class in order to define a closure that can be used with a nicer and more readable syntax as it follows: withTransaction(); { of(this).doSomething(); } To achieve this result the withTransaction() should be defined as: public void withTransaction() { delayedClosure(new DelayedClosure<Void>() { public Void doWithClosure(Closure closure) { beginTransaction(); closure.apply(); commit(); return null; } }); } It is also possible to get a result from the method that uses this kind of closure by reading it from the getClosureResult() method
 

Classes in ch.lambdaj.function.closure used by ch.lambdaj.function.closure
Closure
          A generic (not strongly typed) lambdaj closure
Closure0
          A closure with no free variables
Closure1
          A closure with a single free variable
Closure2
          A closure with two free variables
Closure3
          A closure with three free variables
Closure4
          A closure with four free variables
ClosureResult
          The result returned by a closure defined through the delayed syntax
Switcher
          Enriches the features of the native java switch.
WrongClosureInvocationException
          This Exception is thrown when a closure gets invoked with a wrong number or type of variables
